New Records: England reached their third semifinal in four tournaments
Key Match Events: Bukayo Saka equalized for England 5 minutes after Breel Embolo gave Switzerland the lead
Trent Alexander-Arnold slammed home the decisive penalty to give England the win in the shootout
Jordan Pickford saved from Manuel Akanji in the shootout
Declan Rice had a fizzing shot from the edge of the box brilliantly saved by a diving Yann Sommer in extra time
Xherdan Shaqiri clipped a post direct from a corner in extra time
Pre-Game Insights: England came into the game on the back of two dire performances
Switzerland, impressive victors over Italy last week and seeking their first major semifinal, took the lead after 75 minutes
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate praised his team's character and resilience
Trent Alexander-Arnold said it was an 'incredible' feeling and that the team showed 'a lot of character, belief, a lot of heart and spirit'
Xherdan Shaqiri said losing in a shootout is 'nothing more brutal' and that the Swiss fought and gave it all they had
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went to extra time, with two of the previous three Euro 2024 quarterfinals decided by penalties
The attendance at the Merkur Spiel-Arena was 46,907
